short_description: This function calculates relative hazard ratio from given new predictors, referneces and cox proportional model
long_description: This function calculates relative hazard ratio from given new predictors, referneces and cox proportional model

input_tables.name: cox_coef_model
input_tables.rDescription: This table defining the feature coefficients.
input_tables.description: This table defining the feature coefficients.

input_tables.name: predicts
input_tables.rDescription: This table defining new feature values or unit changes for prediction.
input_tables.description: This table defining new feature values or unit changes for prediction.

input_tables.name: refs
input_tables.rDescription: This table defining reference feature values.
input_tables.description: This table defining reference feature values.

argument_clauses.name: PredictFeatureColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns that contain the values of the features in the Cox coefficient model. This argument must specify a column for each feature specified by predict.feature.names. The ith predict_feature corresponds to the ith pf_value_column.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns that contain the values of the features in the Cox coefficient model. This argument must specify a column for each feature specified by Predict_Feature_Names. The ith predict_feature corresponds to the ith pf_value_column.

argument_clauses.name: PredictFeatureUnitsColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns that contain the unit values of the features in the Cox coefficient model. This argument must specify a column for each feature specified by predict.feature.names. The ith predict_feature corresponds to the ith pf_unit_column.s
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns that contain the unit values of the features in the Cox coefficient model. This argument must specify a column for each feature specified by Predict_Feature_Names. The ith predict_feature corresponds to the ith pf_unit_column.

argument_clauses.name: RefFeatureColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns that contain the reference values. This argument must specify a column for each feature specified by predict.feature.names. The ith predict.feature corresponds to the ith rf_value_column. The default reference values are the distinct featurevalue combinations. Note: The function ignores this argument if you specify predict.feature.units.columns.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns that contain the reference values. This argument must specify a column for each feature specified by Predict_Feature_Names. The ith predict_feature corresponds to the ith rf_value_column. The default reference values are the distinct featurevalue combinations. Note: The function ignores this argument if you specify Predict_Feature_Units_Columns.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the columns in predict_feature_table that the function copies to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the columns in predict_feature_table that the function copies to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: PredictFeatureNames
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the names of the features in the Cox coefficient model (the coefficient table generated by the ta.coxph function).
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the names of the features in the Cox coefficient model (the coefficient table generated by the CoxPH function).

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
